interactions.description: NSAIDs increase the risk of bleeding when used with warfarin by inhibiting platelet function and potentially displacing warfarin from protein binding sites.
interactions.recommendation: Avoid combination if possible. If necessary, use lowest effective NSAID dose for shortest duration and monitor INR closely.
interactions.monitoring: Monitor INR frequently, watch for signs of bleeding

interactions.description: Metronidazole inhibits aldehyde dehydrogenase, causing accumulation of acetaldehyde when alcohol is consumed, leading to severe disulfiram-like reaction.
interactions.recommendation: Absolutely avoid alcohol during treatment and for 48 hours after completing metronidazole.

interactions.description: Macrolide antibiotics (especially clarithromycin and erythromycin) inhibit CYP3A4, increasing statin levels and risk of myopathy/rhabdomyolysis.
interactions.recommendation: Temporarily stop statin during macrolide course, or use azithromycin which has less CYP3A4 interaction.
interactions.monitoring: Monitor for muscle symptoms, check CK if symptoms occur

interactions.description: Combined CNS depression from benzodiazepines and opioids significantly increases risk of respiratory depression, sedation, coma, and death.
interactions.recommendation: Avoid concurrent use. If absolutely necessary, use lowest doses and monitor closely.
interactions.monitoring: Close monitoring in medical setting, have naloxone available

interactions.description: ACE inhibitors reduce aldosterone secretion, decreasing potassium excretion. Combined with potassium supplements, this can cause dangerous hyperkalemia.
interactions.recommendation: Avoid routine potassium supplementation with ACE inhibitors. Monitor potassium levels if supplement is necessary.
alternatives: Dietary potassium from food is usually sufficient

interactions.description: Using multiple NSAIDs together significantly increases the risk of GI bleeding, kidney damage, and cardiovascular events without additional pain relief.
interactions.recommendation: Never use more than one NSAID at a time. If one NSAID is insufficient, consider alternative pain management.
interactions.monitoring: Monitor for GI symptoms, renal function

interactions.description: Both drug classes decrease heart rate and contractility. Combination may cause severe bradycardia, heart block, or hypotension.
interactions.recommendation: Use combination with caution. Monitor heart rate and blood pressure closely. Avoid verapamil/diltiazem with beta blockers.
alternatives: Dihydropyridine CCBs (amlodipine) are safer with beta blockers
interactions.monitoring: Regular ECG monitoring, blood pressure, heart rate

interactions.description: Some PPIs (especially omeprazole and esomeprazole) inhibit CYP2C19, reducing conversion of clopidogrel to its active metabolite and decreasing antiplatelet effect.
symptoms: May be asymptomatic until cardiovascular event occurs
interactions.recommendation: Use pantoprazole or rabeprazole instead of omeprazole/esomeprazole. Consider H2 blockers if PPI not essential.

interactions.description: Fluoroquinolones can lower seizure threshold. NSAIDs may enhance this effect, increasing risk of CNS stimulation and seizures.
interactions.recommendation: Use alternative pain relief during fluoroquinolone therapy. Use with caution in patients with seizure history.
interactions.monitoring: Monitor for CNS symptoms, especially in patients with seizure history

interactions.description: Penicillins reduce renal excretion of methotrexate, potentially leading to toxic methotrexate levels.
interactions.recommendation: Monitor methotrexate levels closely. Consider alternative antibiotics. May need methotrexate dose reduction.
interactions.monitoring: Methotrexate levels, complete blood count, liver and kidney function

interactions.description: SSRIs inhibit serotonin uptake by platelets, impairing platelet aggregation. Combined with NSAIDs, this significantly increases bleeding risk.
interactions.recommendation: Use paracetamol instead of NSAIDs when possible. If NSAID necessary, add gastroprotection with PPI.
interactions.monitoring: Monitor for signs of GI bleeding

interactions.description: Both benzodiazepines and alcohol are CNS depressants. Combined use can cause severe sedation, respiratory depression, and death.
interactions.recommendation: Avoid alcohol completely while taking benzodiazepines.

interactions.description: Beta blockers antagonize the bronchodilator effects of beta-agonists and may precipitate bronchospasm, especially in asthmatics.
interactions.recommendation: Avoid non-selective beta blockers in asthma patients. Use cardioselective beta blockers (bisoprolol, metoprolol) at lowest effective dose if necessary.

interactions.description: Using multiple paracetamol-containing products can lead to unintentional overdose and severe liver damage.
interactions.recommendation: Check all medications for paracetamol content. Do not exceed 4g paracetamol daily from all sources.
alternatives: Single paracetamol product at appropriate dose
interactions.monitoring: Total daily paracetamol intake, liver function if overdose suspected

interactions.description: Both drug classes can cause nephrotoxicity. Combined use increases the risk of acute kidney injury.
interactions.recommendation: If combination necessary, ensure adequate hydration and monitor renal function closely.
interactions.monitoring: Daily renal function tests, maintain adequate hydration

safe_combinations.note: Safe and often used together for cardiovascular protection
